results.title: U.S. to Seek Attempted Assassination Charge for Trump Golf Course Suspect
results.abstract: Prosecutors disclosed new information in a memo written to persuade a federal judge to detain the suspect indefinitely while he awaits trial.

results.title: Sean Combs’s Arrest Has the Music World Asking: Is Our #MeToo Here?
results.abstract: Activists and survivors are hopeful for change after the industry, which has a pervasive party culture, largely avoided the accountability that swept Hollywood and politics.

results.title: Cat Missing in Yellowstone Returns Home to California After an 800-Mile Trek
results.abstract: The owners of Rayne Beau, the 2-year-old Siamese cat, have no idea how their cat made it back, but call his return a “miracle.”

media.caption: Rayne Beau once escaped over a backyard fence. Then he escaped into “the biggest backyard in the United States.”

results.title: What Did ‘The West Wing’ Do to Us?
results.abstract: As Aaron Sorkin’s political fantasy turns 25, its romance has aged better than its politics.

media.caption: “The West Wing,” anchored by Martin Sheen’s President Josiah Bartlet, center, debuted in September 1999. Its core fantasy was that the right thing and the politically effective thing are the same thing.
